msg: Starting example design
detail: Example design is starting

msg: Done!
detail: Example design has completed

msg: Ipdef parameters read for <IPDEF>
msg_edit: Ipdef parameters read for %s
detail: Ipdef parameters were successfully read

detail: obsolete

msg: obsolete
detail: obsolete

msg: Unable to auto-configure user parameter <user_parameter>: <reason>
msg_edit: Unable to auto-configure user parameter %s: %s
detail: The auto-configuration either failed or is not available. Check reason displayed

msg: Successfully auto-configured user parameter <user_parameter> to {<value>}
msg_edit: Successfully auto-configured user parameter %s to {%s}
detail: Report of the auto-configuration result of this parameter

msg: obsolete
detail: obsolete

msg: <user_parameter> user parameter is not specified
msg_edit: %s user parameter is not specified
detail: A mandatory user_parameter was not specified
resolution: This parameter must be set using the user parameter

msg: <file/directory type> does not exist: <file name>
msg_edit: %s does not exist: %s
detail: The file or directory specified via the user parameters does not exists
resolution: This file or directory is required, check that it exists

msg: Reading <file>: <file path>
msg_edit: Reading %s: %s
detail: The wizard is reading a configuration file

msg: Logging a configuration in <file>
msg_edit: Logging a configuration in %s
detail: An intermediary log file is written

msg: Setting permissions (<permissions>) to the folder: <folder>
msg_edit: Setting permissions (%s) to the folder: %s
detail: Permissions are set

msg: obsolete
detail: obsolete

msg: Invalid value provided for user parameter <user_parameter>. Expecting a dictionary. For example: <example>
msg_edit: Invalid value provided for user parameter %s. Expecting a dictionary. For example: {%s}
detail: The value provided is not supported
resolution: Check the value provided by the user or via auto-configuration

msg: Invalid dictionary key provided for user parameter <user_parameter>: <key>. Supported values are <values>
msg_edit: Invalid dictionary key provided for user parameter %s: %s. Supported values are %s
detail: The key provided in the dictionary is not supported
resolution: Check the value provided by the user or via auto-configuration

msg: obsolete
detail: obsolete

msg: Successfully validated <cfg_name> parameter <user_parameter>. Value (<value>) is used
msg_edit: Successfully validated %s parameter %s. Value (%s) is used
detail: The value provided by the user or via auto-configuration for this user parameter is correct. Value of the parameter is reported

msg: Invalid list value (<value>) provided for user parameter <user_parameter>. Supported values are <values>
msg_edit: Invalid list value (%s) provided for user parameter %s. Supported values are %s
detail: The value provided in the list is not supported
resolution: Check the value provided by the user or via auto-configuration

msg: Invalid value (<value>) provided for user parameter <user_parameter>. Supported values are <values>
msg_edit: Invalid value (%s) provided for user parameter %s. Supported values are %s
detail: The value provided is not supported
resolution: Check the value provided by the user or via auto-configuration

msg: Setting user parameter <user parameter> with string read from file: <file name>
msg_edit: Setting user parameter %s with string read from file: %s
detail: Some string user parameters are imported from files (e.g. power floorplan sources)

msg: Successfully set user parameter <user parameter> with <number of lines> lines read from file: <file name>
msg_edit: Successfully set user parameter %s with %s lines read from file: %s
detail: Report the number of lines imported from file

msg: Reserved for build_xclbin.sh
detail: Reserved for build_xclbin.sh

msg: Unable to auto-configure <user_parameter> for element %s: <info>
msg_edit: Unable to auto-configure %s for element %s: %s
detail: The auto-configuration of this parameter, initially set to {}, resulted in setting it as unused

msg: Actual user parameter <param name> value (<param value>) is used
msg_edit: Actual user parameter %s value (%s) is used
detail: Reporting the actual value of user parameter either auto-configured or provided by the user

msg: Unknown node found in <file>: <node>
msg_edit: Unknown node found in %s: %s
detail: The wizard configuration JSON file is not valid
resolution: Correct the wizard configuration JSON file

msg: Cannot find parameter <node> in auto-configuration or wizard configuration JSON file
msg_edit: Cannot find parameter %s in auto-configuration or wizard configuration JSON file
detail: The parameter was not found in auto-configuration (platform info or default value) and in wizard configuration JSON file (default and <wizard_config_name>
resolution: Check auto-configuration and/or wizard-configuration JSON file

msg: Unsetting element <element> from auto-configured dictionary parameter <parameter> as <reason>
msg_edit: Unsetting element %s from auto-configured dictionary parameter %s as %s
detail: A parameter was not found or was found invalid during auto-configuration so the wizard will not use it
resolution: Check platform metadata definition or (re)-define the element in the wizard-configuration JSON file

msg: Unsetting auto-configured parameter <parameter> as <reason>
msg_edit: Unsetting auto-configured parameter %s as %s
detail: A parameter was not found or was found invalid during auto-configuration so the wizard will not use it
resolution: Check platform metadata definition or (re)-define the element in the wizard-configuration JSON file

msg: Auto-configuration of parameter is not supported for platform provided <xpfm>: <reason>
msg_edit: Auto-configuration of parameter is not supported for platform provided %s: %s
detail: xbtest wizard cannot find platform metadata it is expecting
resolution: All parameters must be defined in the wizard-configuration JSON file

msg: Loading platform metadata from provided <XSA/XPFM> with command: <cmd>
msg_edit: Loading platform metadata from provided %s with command: %s
detail: Trying to load platform info as HW XSA instead of XPFM

msg: <file/directory type> does not exist (<file name>). The power CUs will be generated with a single SLICE site and the build will be stopped after the implementation opt phase
msg_edit: %s does not exist (%s). The power CUs will be generated with a single SLICE site and the build will be stopped after the implementation opt phase
detail: A required power floorplan configuration file is missing but the build will continue to until a DCP is available which may be used to generate dynamic_geometry.json
resolution: This file or directory is required, check that it exists or re-generate it

msg: Loading <file/directory type>: <file name>
msg_edit: Loading %s: %s
detail: Load JSON file

msg: Required parameter <param name> not found in platform metadata and not specified in wizard configuration JSON file
msg_edit: Required parameter %s not found in platform metadata and not specified in wizard configuration JSON file
detail: This parameter is needed in platform metadata
resolution: Check if the parameter is defined in the platform metadata and if not present then define it in wizard configuration

msg: Required file not found in provided Vitis options directory (vpp_options_dir): <file name>
msg_edit: Required file not found in provided Vitis options directory (vpp_options_dir): %s
detail: A required Vitis options file was not found in the directory provided
resolution: This file or directory is required when a Vitis options directory is provided, make sure it exists

msg: Output file sucessfully written: <file name>
msg_edit: Output file sucessfully written: %s
detail: Successfully wrote an output file

msg: Verify CU location set to <slr> as <justification>
msg_edit: Verify CU location set to %s as %s
detail: Report verify CU SLR location

msg: Verify CU DNA read <enabled/disabled> as <justification>
msg_edit: Verify CU DNA read %s as %s
detail: Report verify CU DNA read

msg: Verify CU DNA read enabled but no CONFIG_SITE was found in dynamic_geometry.json <justification>
msg_edit: Verify CU DNA read enabled but no CONFIG_SITE was found in dynamic_geometry.json %s
detail: Verify CU DNA read is enabled by user but that configuration might not be valid
resolution: Define CONFIG_SITE in dynamic_geometry.json or remove dna_read from wizard configuration JSON file

msg: <user_parameter> not defined by the user or via auto-configuration. Cannot configure <CU type> compute unit
msg_edit: %s not defined by the user or via auto-configuration. Cannot configure %s compute unit
detail: A required user parameter is not defined. See user guide
resolution: If this parameter can be auto-configured, then check the platform metadata. Or set the user parameter manually

msg: The following configuration for a <CU type> compute unit has been generated: {<configuration>}
msg_edit: The following configuration for a %s compute unit has been generated: {%s}
detail: A compute unit configuration has successfully been generated

msg: No <CU type> compute unit is found in user configuration. Skipping
msg_edit: No %s compute unit is found in user configuration. Skipping
detail: No compute unit will be generated

msg: <number of configurations> configurations have been generated for <CU type> compute unit
msg_edit: %s configurations have been generated for %s compute unit
detail: Report the number of configurations generated for a compute unit type

msg: Starting generation of compute unit configurations
detail: Initial message displayed at the beginning of the generation of the compute unit configurations

msg: No compute unit configured. Check wizard configuration JSON file and selected configuration name: <config name>
msg_edit: No compute unit configured. Check wizard configuration JSON file and selected configuration name: %s
detail: At least one compute unit configuration must be generated
resolution: Check the xbtest_wizard user parameters

msg: Total number of generated compute unit configurations: <number of configurations>
msg_edit: Total number of generated compute unit configurations: %s
detail: Report total number of configurations. One configuration is generated per compute unit

msg: AIE utilization not defined in utilization.json (AIE_UTILIZATION) for SLR<idx>
msg_edit: AIE utilization not defined in utilization.json (AIE_UTILIZATION) for SLR%s
detail: When the platform supports AIE, the utilization must be defined
resolution: Check the power floorplan definition

msg: Writing file: <file name>
msg_edit: Writing file: %s
detail: The necessary files to build the xclbin are generated

msg: AIE usage for power CU in SLR<idx> is enabled in <utilization.json>
msg_edit: AIE usage for power CU in SLR%s is enabled in %s
detail: Report AIE sites will be used by the power CU

msg: AIE usage for power CU found in more than one SLR and is not supported
detail: In this version, the AIE can be only used in one SLR
resolution: Set utilisation > 0 only for one SLR in utilization.json

msg: Auto-configured power CU in SLR<idx> throttle mode from default to (<throttle_mode>)
msg_edit: Auto-configured power CU in SLR%s throttle mode from default to (%s)
detail: The throttle mode of the power CU is auto-configured when it is not provided for a SLR

msg: Successfully generated kernel XML file: <file name>
msg_edit: Successfully generated kernel XML file: %s
detail: The kernel XML file was generated. This file will be included in the kernel XO file

msg: Setting in kernel XML file the scalar and AXI pointer arguments of compute unit: <CU name>
msg_edit: Setting in kernel XML file the scalar and AXI pointer arguments of compute unit: %s
detail: The arguments of the compute units  are configured in the kernel XML file

msg: Starting generation of compute units XO files
detail: Each compute unit has a different XO file which is being generated

msg: Successfully generated XO files for all compute units
detail: The XO files generation for all compute unit has completed. See message above to see which compute units have been packaged

msg: Packaging compute unit: <CU name>
msg_edit: Packaging compute unit: %s
detail: Report the number of lines imported from file

msg: Setting user parameter <user_parameter> of <CU name> compute unit to: {<value>}
msg_edit: Setting user parameter %s of %s compute unit to: {%s}
detail: Report the value of a user parameter set for a compute unit

msg: <user_parameter> not defined by the user or via auto-configuration. Cannot generate GT compute unit <CU name>
msg_edit: %s not defined by the user or via auto-configuration. Cannot generate GT compute unit %s
detail: A required user parameter is not defined. See user guide
resolution: If this parameter can be auto-configured, then check the platform metadata. Or set the user parameter manually

msg: Creating <interface type> interface for <CU name> compute unit: {<interface name>}
msg_edit: Creating %s interface for %s compute unit: {%s}
detail: An additional interface has been created

msg: Value (<value>) is not supported for user parameter (<user_parameter>). Supported values are: <values>. Cannot generate GT compute unit (<CU name>)
msg_edit: Value (%s) is not supported for user parameter (%s). Supported values are: %s. Cannot generate GT compute unit (%s)
detail: Value not supported. See user guide
resolution: Provide a valid settings

msg: Starting generation of bash script to be executed to generate xclbin: <file name>
msg_edit: Starting generation of bash script to be executed to generate xclbin: %s
detail: Initial message displayed at the beginning of the generation of bash script

msg: Kernel XO file does not exist: <file name>
msg_edit: Kernel XO file does not exist: %s
detail: Unable to find kernel XO file to be set as Vitis input for the xclbin generation
resolution: Check if this file has not been moved

msg: Compute unit <CU name> interface <interface name> connectivity: {<SP tag>}
msg_edit: Compute unit %s interface %s connectivity: {%s}
detail: Report the connectivity of an interface of the compute unit instance

msg: Compute unit <CU name> SLR assignment: {<SLR>}
msg_edit: Compute unit %s SLR assignment: {%s}
detail: Report the SLR assignment of the compute unit instance

msg: Using Vitis INI options file specified in the user parameters: <file name>
msg_edit: Using Vitis INI options file specified in the user parameters: %s
detail: Report the Vitis INI options file name used. This file may overwrite options specified in Vitis INI options file generated by xbtest as it is sourced by Vitis at last

msg: Checking Vitis INI options file: <file name>
msg_edit: Checking Vitis INI options file: %s
detail: Some of the parameters in the provided Vitis INI options file are checked

msg: The connectivity of compute unit interface <interface name> should not be set in the Vitis INI options file provided
msg_edit: The connectivity of compute unit interface %s should not be set in the Vitis INI options file provided
detail: The connectivity of compute unit interface <interface name> is already set in the generated Vitis INI options file
resolution: Remove its connectivity from the provided Vitis INI options file

msg: After executing the bash script to generate xclbin, the xclbin file will be found here: <file name>
msg_edit: After executing the bash script to generate xclbin, the xclbin file will be found here: %s
detail: The xclbin is generated by Vitis, and the file name is set by xclbinutil while setting the USER_METADATA section

msg: obsolete
detail: obsolete
resolution: obsolete

msg: Writing file: <file name>
msg_edit: Writing file: %s
detail: The necessary files to build the xclbin are generated

msg: Compute unit <CU name> interface <interface name> is NOT connected: {<SP tag>}
msg_edit: Compute unit %s interface %s is NOT connected: {%s}
detail: Report the connectivity of an interface of the compute unit instance
resolution: Make sure that not having PLRAM connection is intentional

msg: Step: <free form message>
msg_edit: Step: %s
detail: Used to display intermediate message

msg: Reference to TCL hook <hook> not found in the Vitis INI options file provided
msg_edit: Reference to TCL hook %s not found in the Vitis INI options file provided
detail: A mandtory TCL hook must be provided in Vitis option directory and it must be referenced in Vitis INI options file
resolution: Add reference to this TCL hook in your Vitis INI options file

msg: No master power CU found for connection to slave power CU
detail: The wizard found some slave power CU but no power CU was configured as master. The slave power CU will not be able to consume power
resolution: One power CU throttle_mode should be INTERNAL_CLK or INTERNAL_MACRO

msg: Throttle mode were mixed. Found slave power CU <slave_inst> (<slave_mode>) mixed with master power CU <master_inst> (<master_mode>)
msg_edit: Throttle mode were mixed. Found slave power CU %s (%s) mixed with master power CU %s (%s)
detail: Destination power CU throttle_mode is set to EXTERNAL_CLK or EXTERNAL_MACRO, while the source power CU throttle mode must be respectively set to INTERNAL_CLK or INTERNAL_MACRO
resolution: Use the same kind of throttling for all master/slave power CU (CLK or MACRO)

msg: Starting generation of bash script to compile PS kernels: <file name>
msg_edit: Starting generation of bash script to compile PS kernels: %s
detail: Initial message displayed at the beginning of the generation of bash script

msg: No PS kernel to be added to xclbin
detail: PS kernel not applicable based on xclbin configuration

msg: After executing the bash script to compile PS kernels, the PS kernels shared libraries <cu name> will be found here: <file name>
msg_edit: After executing the bash script to compile PS kernels, the PS kernels shared libraries %s will be found here: %s
detail: The bash script to compile PS kernels is run after Vitis. PS kernels can be added to xclbin after this script is run

msg: Writing file: <file name>
msg_edit: Writing file: %s
detail: The necessary files to compile the PS kernels are generated

msg: Starting generation of pre-canned test JSON files
msg_edit: Starting generation of pre-canned test JSON files
detail: Initial message displayed at the beginning of the generation of pre-canned test

msg: Generating <name> pre-canned test: <file>
msg_edit: Generating %s pre-canned test: %s
detail: Starting the generation of a pre-canned test

msg: Pre-canned <name> not applicable: <reason>
msg_edit: Pre-canned %s not applicable: %s
detail: Pre-canned test is not generated based on xclbin configuration

msg: Starting generation of platform definition JSON file: <file>
msg_edit: Starting generation of platform definition JSON file: %s
detail: Initial message displayed at the beginning of the generation of pre-canned test

msg: Starting generation of power floorplan and project that can be used to display them
detail: A Vivado project is created and can be opened to display the sites used in the power floorplan

msg: Successfully generated power floorplan and its display project is available
detail: The Vivado project that can be used to display the sites used in the power floorplan is available

msg: Creating Vivado project <project name> with part <FPGA part> in the target directory: <project directory>
msg_edit: Creating Vivado project %s with part %s in the target directory: %s
detail: The Vivado project is created for the reported FPGA part

msg: <Display power floorplan info>
msg_edit: %s
detail: This explains the commands to run to display power floorplan

msg: Starting elaboration of compute unit: <CU name>
msg_edit: Starting elaboration of compute unit: %s
detail: Initial message displayed at the beginning of the elaboration phase of a compute unit

msg: User parameter <user_parameter> of <CU name> compute unit is set to: {<value>}
msg_edit: User parameter %s of %s compute unit is set to: {%s}
detail: Report the value of a user parameter set for a compute unit

msg: Creating <sub-core name> sub-core <sub-core VLNV> of <CU name> compute unit
msg_edit: Creating %s sub-core %s of %s compute unit
detail: Starting creation and configuration of a sub-core of a compute unit

msg: Successfully created <sub-core name> sub-core <sub-core VLNV> of <CU name> compute unit
msg_edit: Successfully created %s sub-core %s of %s compute unit
detail: End of creation and configuration of a sub-core of a compute unit

msg: Setting the properties of <sub-core name> sub-core <sub-core VLNV> of <CU name> compute unit to: {<properties>}
msg_edit: Setting the properties of %s sub-core %s of %s compute unit to: {%s}
detail: Report the properties of a sub-core of a compute unit

msg: User parameter not defined to set property of <sub-core name> sub-core <sub-core VLNV> of <CU name> compute unit: <user_parameter>
msg_edit: User parameter not defined to set property of %s sub-core %s of %s compute unit: %s
detail: A required user parameter is not defined. See user guide
resolution: Check the user_parameters of xbtest_wizard

msg: Finished elaboration of compute unit: <CU name>
msg_edit: Finished elaboration of compute unit: %s
detail: Message displayed at the end of the elaboration phase of a compute unit

msg: <CU Name>: elaborate IP <IP>, version <Version>
msg_edit: %s: elaborate IP %s, version %s
detail: Report the IP and its version used during elaboration of the compute unit

msg: <CU Name>: <IP>, version not >= min and < max. Cannot elaborate compute unit
msg_edit: %s: %s, version not >= %s and < %s. Cannot elaborate compute unit
detail: The version of the IP is not recent enough and not compatible with CU. See user guide
resolution: Use recommended version of the IP, check Vivado version associated with this CU

msg: Starting generation of power floorplan for SLR: {<SLR>}
msg_edit: Starting generation of power floorplan for SLR: {%s}
detail: Initial message displayed at the beginning of the generation of power floorplan of a compute unit

msg: <SLR> not defined in platform dynamic region geometry. Valid SLRs are: <SLR list>)
msg_edit: %s not defined in platform dynamic region geometry. Valid SLRs are: %s
detail: The SLR provided is not defined in platform dynamic region geometry (dynamic_geometry.json)
resolution: Check dynamic_geometry.json or try to re-generate it (see user guide)

msg: Checking input: {<parameter name>}
msg_edit: Checking input: {%s}
detail: The inputs of the power floorplan generation are checked before the generation starts

msg: Starting generation of the list of sites defining the power floorplan
detail: The list of actual sites present in  the power floorplan is generated base on the inputs provided

msg: Generating the physical constraints (LOC, timing) for each site in the power floorplan
detail: For each site, placement constraints are used. Timing constraints are also set for some

msg: Generating SV package containing the number of sites to be instantiated
detail: This will configure the number of sites to be synthesized

msg: Power floorplan successfully generated
detail: The power floorplan was successfully generated

msg: Failed to generate power floorplan
detail: The power floorplan was not generated
resolution: Check the errors displayed before

msg: obsolete
detail: obsolete

msg: Incorrect definition of PL_INVALID: <error>
msg_edit: Incorrect definition of PL_INVALID: %s
detail: The definition of PL_INVALID in power floorplan input file invalid.json is incorrect
resolution: Check the value of PL_INVALID

msg: Incorrect definition of PL_UTILIZATION: <error>
msg_edit: Incorrect definition of PL_UTILIZATION: %s
detail: The definition of PL_UTILIZATION in power floorplan input file utilization.json is incorrect
resolution: Check the value of PL_UTILIZATION

msg: Processing for site type: <site_type>
msg_edit: Processing for site type: %s
detail: Generation starts for a site type of the list of sites defining the power floorplan

msg: Processing for SLR: <SLR>
msg_edit: Processing for SLR: %s
detail: Generation starts for a SLR of the list of sites defining the power floorplan

msg: Saving physical constraints for site type <site type> in: <file name>
msg_edit: Saving physical constraints for site type %s in: %s
detail: The physical constraints are saved into a file for debug. These constraints are also output in a XDC file to be used during the implementation

msg: Saving number of sites for SLR <SLR> in: <file name>
msg_edit: Saving number of sites for SLR %s in: %s
detail: The physical constraints are saved into a file for debug. These parameters are also output in a SV file to be used during the synthesis

msg: Invalid argument for report_utilization command option <option>: <argument>
msg_edit: Invalid argument for report_utilization command option %s: %s
detail: The provided argument is not correct
resolution: For more info, try the command: report_utilization help

msg: Invalid argument for display_pwr_fp command option <option>: <argument>
msg_edit: Invalid argument for display_pwr_fp command option %s: %s
detail: The provided argument is not correct
resolution: For more info, try the command: display_pwr_fp help

msg: <statistics>
msg_edit: %s
detail: Report statistics of the power kernel floorplan (utilization, power estimation)

msg: Power floorplan input <parameter name> set to: {<parameter value>}
msg_edit: Power floorplan input %s set to: {%s}
detail: Report input of the power kernel floorplan generation

msg: Starting generation of power floorplan for <target SV or XDC>
msg_edit: Starting generation of power floorplan for %s
detail: Initial message displayed at the beginning of the generation of power floorplan of a compute unit for SV parameter or XDC in TTCL

msg: No <site type> found in dynamic_geometry.json for SLR: <SLR>
msg_edit: No %s found in dynamic_geometry.json for SLR: %s
detail: The generation will continue for other sites
resolution: If this is not expected, check dynamic_geometry.json or try to re-generate it (see user guide)
